data.title: Hometown Health Centers
data.meta_description:
Hometown Health Centers | 173 followers on LinkedIn. OUR MISSION:
Hometown Health Centers helps people live healthier lives by improving health outcomes and health equity. | Hometown Health Centers helps people live healthier lives by improving health outcomes and health equity through quality primary care and preventative services. Anyone seeking care, regardless of income, will be helped and treated with respect by people who are mindful of cultural uniqueness and dedicated to continuous improvement.
data.text:
If you are interested in applying, please visit our careers page at: https://lnkd.in/gbDzwvvx RESPONSIBILITIES: The General Dentist will: ✔ Perform dental examinations and routine check-ups for patients ✔ Diagnose and treat dental conditions such as cavities, gum diseases, and oral infections ✔ Keep accurate and complete records of patient care and related activities. ✔ Coordinate care through verbal/written interaction with patients’ medical providers. ✔ Participate in Quality Assurance activities as determined by the CDO. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: ✔ DDS or DMD from an accredited dental school. ✔ Licensed to practice dentistry in New York State. ✔Familiarity with New York State Dental Medicaid guidelines. BENEFITS: ✔ Generous paid time off (Vacation, Sick, Personal, Floating Holiday and paid holidays) ✔ Medical, dental, and vision insurance ✔ 401(k) retirement plan with employer match ✔ Student Loan forgiveness ✔ Tuition reimbursement program ✔ Employer-paid Life and AD& D insurance ✔ Employer–paid Short-term and long-term disability benefits ✔ Employee Assistance Program (EAP) ✔ Flexible Spending Account (FSA) ✔ Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) ✔ Other Employee perks

⚕ Join our team! Seeking Family Medicine Physician SALARY RANGE: $200,000 - $240,000 POSITION SUMMARY: The family medicine physician provides acute, chronic, and preventative medical care to individuals and families from all life cycles, including pediatric, adolescent, perinatal, adult and geriatric patients. ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: ✔ Refers or admits patients with serious conditions to the hospital for inpatient care. ✔ Assesses patients and develops diagnostic and treatment plans. Educates patients and families. ✔ Orders appropriate laboratory, radiology, or other ancillary tests and interprets results. ✔ Orders/prescribes medications according to NYS law and monitors for efficacy and reactions. ✔ May perform minor surgical procedures (e.g. suturing, removal of skin lesions and cysts, incision and drainage) and certain GYN procedures (e.g. IUD insertion and removal) pending approval of privileges. ✔ May provide obstetric care, if appropriately privileged by St. Peter’s Health Partners or Ellis Medicine. May perform D&Cs and colposcopies, with appropriate privileges. ✔ Consults with and refers to specialists and ancillary HHC staff as necessary. ✔ Completes medical records, correspondence, and forms in a timely manner as per protocols. ✔ Completes appropriate medical records flow sheets, problem lists, and medication lists. ✔ May participate in an after-hours call schedule shared with other physicians, PAs and NPs. ✔ May participate in a rounding schedule with other physicians to care for hospitalized patients. If providing in-patient care, must maintain clinical privileges at St. Peter's Health and/or Ellis Hospitals and must abide by the by-laws of those hospitals. ✔ Provides medical supervision to the assigned staff of nurses, NPs, PAs, and other medical support staff. ✔ Precepts medical students, residents and other students. ✔ Participates in QA/QI activities and assumes additional responsibilities as assigned by the CMO. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: Medical supervision of assigned nurses, NPs, PAs, and other support staff. TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS: Must be willing to travel to Schenectady, Amsterdam, and School-Based sites. If you are interested in applying, please visit our careers page at: https://lnkd.in/gbDzwvvx

Join our Medical Team! We are seeking full-time/part-time Nurse Practitioners (NP) and Physician Assistants. Are you a compassionate medical professional and want to make a difference in the lives of those in need in our community? Hometown Health Centers (HHC) provides the highest quality of comprehensive primary, preventative, and behavioral health services to all who seek them, regardless of insurance status and ability to pay, especially for the underserved and vulnerable. HHC is a Federally Qualified, Non-Profit Health Center serving in Schenectady. We offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits packages, and great work-life balance. Minimum Qualifications: ✔ Graduate of a registered approved Nurse Practitioner (NP)/Physician Assistant (PA) Program ✔ Completion of required State/National Certification Programs ✔ Current licensure and registration in the State of New York, Board Certification as a Nurse Practitioner/Physician Assistant, and DEA license. ✔ Demonstrated competence in a multicultural medical setting ✔ Previous experience providing medical care within a pediatric/family medicine practice setting. ✔ Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: ✔ Two to three years of clinical experience preferred. ✔ Experience in Community Health. ✔ Experience in delivering culturally competent healthcare. ✔ Bilingual/Multi-lingual abilities.

⚕ Join our team! Seeking Family Medicine Physicians for a Community Health Center Job Summary Our physicians provide acute, chronic, and preventive medical care to individuals and families from all life cycles, including pediatric, adolescent, perinatal, adult, and geriatric patients. Educational Requirements: ✔ MD with degree from an accredited medical school. ✔ Board-eligible/certified in family practice. ✔ Licensed as a physician in the State of New York. ✔ Meets all the requirements of the Center’s credentialing/re-credentialing process. Experience/Training: Must maintain certification by re-examination every 7 years. Medical Specialties: Internal Medicine | OB/GYN | Pediatrics | Primary Care Benefits: ✔ Generous paid time off (Vacation, Sick, Personal, Floating Holiday and paid holidays) ✔ Medical, dental, and vision insurance ✔ 401(k) retirement plan with employer match ✔ Student Loan forgiveness ✔ Tuition reimbursement program ✔ Employer-paid Life and AD& D insurance ✔ Employer–paid Short-term and long-term disability benefits ✔ Employee Assistance Program (EAP) ✔ Flexible Spending Account (FSA) ✔ Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) ✔ Other Employee perks If you are interested in applying, please visit our careers page at https://lnkd.in/dsYmwCrc
